Episodes.Title: Bug Out
Episodes.Writer: James Fritzell, Everett Greenbaum, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When a rumor for a camp relocation turns out to be real, Hawkeye, Margaret and Radar volunteer to stay behind for a patient who cannot be moved.

Episodes.Title: Margaret's Engagement
Episodes.Writer: Gary Markowitz, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Margaret's sudden engagement comes as a surprise to everyone, but Frank predictably takes it the hardest.

Episodes.Title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye is temporarily blinded while trying to fix the nurses' furnace, and Frank finds a sure-fire way to win bets on baseball games.

Episodes.Title: Lt. Radar O'Reilly
Episodes.Writer: Everett Greenbaum, James Fritzell, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: To settle a poker debt, an officer forges promotion papers for Radar to become a Lieutenant.

Episodes.Title: The Nurses
Episodes.Writer: Linda Bloodworth-Thomason, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The nurses go behind Margaret's back so that a fellow nurse confined to her tent can spend the night with her soldier husband who is paying her a surprise visit.

Episodes.Title: The Abduction of Margaret Houlihan
Episodes.Writer: Allan Katz, Don Reo, Gene Reynolds
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Margaret takes off in the middle of the night to help deliver a Korean baby. Nobody knows of her whereabouts, and Colonel Flagg is brought in to help investigate her disappearance.

Episodes.Title: Dear Sigmund
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Psychiatrist Sidney Freedman composes a letter to Sigmund Freud during a visit to the 4077, while the rest of the camp endures the hijinks of a mystery prankster.

Episodes.Title: Mulcahy's War
Episodes.Writer: Charlie Hauck, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Father Mulcahy, troubled by his lack of experience at the front, insists on accompanying Radar for an errand there.

Episodes.Title: The Korean Surgeon
Episodes.Writer: Bill Idelson, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Instead of turning him in as a prisoner of war, Hawkeye and B.J. pull some strings to get a wounded North Korean surgeon a spot on the staff.

Episodes.Title: Hawkeye Get Your Gun
Episodes.Writer: Jay Folb, Gene Reynolds, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye and Potter provide assistance at a Korean clinic, and run into an enemy attack on the way home. Meanwhile, Klinger begins posing as a Gypsy to help get his discharge papers.

Episodes.Title: The Colonel's Horse
Episodes.Writer: James Fritzell, Everett Greenbaum, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Everybody pitches in to save Colonel Potter's horse, who becomes sick while Potter is away in Tokyo. And Margaret asks Hawkeye, not Frank, to operate on her appendix.

Episodes.Title: Exorcism
Episodes.Writer: Jay Folb, Gene Reynolds, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: To save the life of an elderly local who rejects an operation because he believes bad spirits surround the 4077th, Colonel Potter permits a Korean exorcism.

Episodes.Title: Hawk's Nightmare
Episodes.Writer: Burt Prelutsky, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye starts sleepwalking and having horrific nightmares. He begins to think that he may be starting to lose his "war against the war."

Episodes.Title: The Most Unforgettable Characters
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Radar becomes an aspiring writer after ordering a flier from a comic book, and Hawkeye and B.J. give Frank a surprise birthday present that only he will appreciate.

Episodes.Title: 38 Across
Episodes.Writer: James Fritzell, Everett Greenbaum, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A fouled radio call for help on a crossword puzzle leads to a senior officer coming to the 4077th to help with a supposed serious medical problem.

Episodes.Title: Ping Pong
Episodes.Writer: Sid Dorfman, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The 4077th hosts a traditional Korean wedding, much to Frank's objections. And Colonel Potter runs into an old friend who has put his troops in jeopardy so that he could receive a promotion.

Episodes.Title: End Run
Episodes.Writer: John D. Hess, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A former star college football player suffers a severe leg injury in combat and must deal with the consequences, and Major Burns goes behind Colonel Potter's back to set up a boxing match between Klinger and Zale.

Episodes.Title: Hanky Panky
Episodes.Writer: Gene Reynolds, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: B.J. falls off the fidelity wagon while trying to provide consolation to a nurse whose marriage has just ended. But will he confess his infidelity to his wife?

Episodes.Title: Hepatitis
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The 4077th has an outbreak of hepatitis and Hawkeye needs to inoculate the reluctant staff while dealing with back pain.

Episodes.Title: The General's Practitioner
Episodes.Writer: Burt Prelutsky, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: General Korshak wants Hawkeye to be his personal practitioner, despite his constant snottiness. And Radar helps take care of a soldier's half-Korean baby after he is shipped back home.

Episodes.Title: Movie Tonight
Episodes.Writer: Gene Reynolds, Don Reo, Allan Katz
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Colonel Potter hopes a Western movie will be the cure for the 4077th's morale problem. But, during the show, the staff is forced to make its own entertainment during the frequent film breakages.

Episodes.Title: Souvenirs
Episodes.Writer: Burt Prelutsky, Reinhold Weege, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye and BJ try to stop a chopper pilot from selling souvenirs derived from war materials derived from locals facing danger getting them, and Klinger becomes a pole-sitter in his latest attempt to get a Section Eight.

Episodes.Title: Post Op
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Gene Reynolds
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The 4077th is deluged with patients and their individual medical histories. Then they run out of blood and everyone is donating at 48-hour intervals.

Episodes.Title: Margaret's Marriage
Episodes.Writer: Everett Greenbaum, James Fritzell, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Pressured by Frank, Margaret decides to marry Colonel Donald Penobscott at the 4077th. When Donald arrives in camp, he is treated to a bachelor party and a practical joke while the nurses give Margaret a bridal shower.
